title: Inside Adnan Syed’s life in prison from his secret marriage to jobs
text:
The Case of Adnan Syed provided updates on the case (Picture: Sky Crime)

Every single morsel of Adnan Syed’s murder case has been analysed, scrutinised and picked apart by prosecutors, armchair detectives and actual detectives alike.

The 39-year-old has been in prison since the age of 18 when he was arrested and later convicted of the murder of his high school girlfriend Hae Min Lee.

It’s undoubtedly one of the most talked-about murder cases in recent history, and birthed a new age of fascination with true crime documentaries and podcasts.

Interest in Adnan’s case has unwavered since the masses were first introduced to the story through Serial, the record-breaking podcast hosted by Sara Keonig.

Sky’s true crime series, The Case of Adnan Syed, highlighted updates in Adnan’s ongoing appeal, while also featuring those key players involved with the tragic case, and also revealing how his family are coping with the neverending legal process.

Those with in-depth knowledge of the case can probably tell you facts without hesitation, but little is known about Adnan’s life in prison over the past 19 years.

Here’s a look at what Adnan has been up to behind bars…

Adnan remains in jail and maintains his innocence (Picture: Barbara Haddock Taylor/The Baltimore Sun via AP)

Adnan Syed’s marriage

It may come as a huge surprise but Adnan has actually been married despite serving a life sentence for murder.

Rumours began circulating on the Adnan Syed ‘encyclopedia’ Reddit forum that he has a wife, but they were never confirmed.

That was until Undisclosed, the Serial follow-up hosted by his longtime friend Rabia Chaudry, said the rumours were actually true.

In 2015, the podcast tweeted: ‘Yes it’s true, married but divorced later. Still friends today.’

When a follower asked if his wife was someone connected to the case, they replied with a simple: ‘No.’

According to Undisclosed, Sarah Koenig chose not to include this detail about his personal life in Serial, presumably to focus on the murder case.

Adnan was 18 when he was convicted of Hae’s murder (Picture: Syed Family, HBO)

Adnan’s said to be an exemplary inmate

Social life

Despite being locked up for more than half his life, Adnan seems to have pretty good access to events in the outside world, as well as entertainment.

Rabia told the audience at the TCA panel in February: ‘Adnan hears everything about himself from the news. The guards keep him updated. He gets all the newspapers and magazines.’

Serial host Sarah also detailed the extent of Adnan’s entertainment, which includes video games.

The journalist said on podcast Fresh Air: ‘He doesn’t have Internet. … He has an Xbox, one of those game things for the TV, and apparently you can play a CD on it, so at one point I said, “I can burn [Serial transcripts] onto CDs for you and send you those”.

‘I think he has to get special permission to receive a CD in prison, and he said, “Yeah, yeah, yeah. I’ll let you know when I get the permission”.’

Trouble behind bars

Adnan is said to be an upstanding inmate, rarely getting in trouble.

However, he does have one infraction that is public knowledge, which is being found in possession of a mobile phone in 2009.

The Case of Adnan Syed is available to watch on Sky Crime.
